name: All About the Goldmans Quiz | Family Guy | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is Mrs. Goldman's first name?
questions.explanation:
Muriel.

	Muriel is voiced by Nicole Sullivan who used to work on "MAD TV" alongside Alex Borstein who voices Lois Griffin.

Swords.

	Mort says this in "Mr. Saturday Knight".  He is afraid of swords because he was poked in the ear with a sword once when he was three and again when he was thirty.

questions.text: What school club is Neil Goldman a member of?
questions.explanation:
The Newspaper Club.

	Neil helps meg get a job at the school newspaper because she needs extracurricular activities to attend Brown University.

questions.text: Neil was once the intern of what news anchor?
questions.explanation:
Tom Tucker.

	Neil and Meg both applied to be interns on the Channel Five News, and both got the internship in "Kiss Seen Around the World".

Pharmacist.

	Mort is seen at the pharmacy in "Ready, Willing and Disabled", and he tells about his job in "Mr. Saturday Knight".

questions.text: At what age did Mort and his wife first kiss?
questions.explanation:
Fourteen & 14.

	Mort states that he and Muriel kissed on a cold winter's night in the episode "Kiss Seen Around the World".

questions.text: How many members of the Goldman family wear glasses?
questions.explanation:
All three.

	All three wear the same glasses, have the same acne, and the same curly orange hair.  Oddly, they are only seen in two episodes together as a family.

Yes.

	In "Kiss Seen Around the World", Neil kisses Meg and shows it on the news.  Meg retaliates with her own news article about Neil.  Meg later kisses Neil in future episodes.

questions.text: The Goldmans live on Spooner St.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The Goldmans do not live on Spooner Street otherwise they'd be seen more often.  The whole family was introduced in the third season of the show.

Seth Green.

	Seth Green also plays he voice of Chris.  Seth Green has played in many TV shows and movies such as "Austin Powers", "Greg the Bunny", and "That 70's Show".
